intro: Rhododendron tetramerum, commonly known as the alpine rhododendron, is a species native to the mountainous regions of Asia, particularly in China, Nepal, and Bhutan. It is a shrub that typically grows in high-altitude forests and alpine meadows, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. The plant produces showy, clustered flowers that are usually pink or purple, blooming in late spring to early summer.
